perturbation.original_text: theglobe shall have sole control over the Service's look and feel, and Boxlot shall not make any change in the Service's look and feel without theglobe's prior consent.  Further, Boxlot shall notify theglobe if Boxlot changes or adds any functionality of the services described in Exhibit A (as modified by Boxlot over time) as implemented on the Boxlot Site.  Unless requested by theglobe, Boxlot shall implement such changes or additions to the Service and make such implementation available on the Shadow Site for theglobe's approval within 30 days of their introduction on the Boxlot Site.  However, under no circumstances shall Boxlot offer Users any community features (such as email, chat, message boards, or the ability to create home pages) from the Co-Branded Pages without theglobe's consent, and if Boxlot desires to do so, the parties will work together to discuss appropriate implementations.  Boxlot shall make available via the Shadow Site all changes to the Service or the Co-Branded Pages completed in this Section 2, and Boxlot shall not implement such changes on the publicly available Service or Co-Branded Pages until it has received theglobe's approval.
perturbation.changed_text: Boxlot shall have complete autonomy over the Service's look and feel, and shall be free to make any change in the Service's look and feel without theglobe's consent.  Further, Boxlot shall notify theglobe if Boxlot changes or adds any functionality of the services described in Exhibit A (as modified by Boxlot over time) as implemented on the Boxlot Site.  Unless requested by theglobe, Boxlot shall implement such changes or additions to the Service and make such implementation available on the Shadow Site for theglobe's approval within 30 days of their introduction on the Boxlot Site.  However, Boxlot may offer Users any community features (such as email, chat, message boards, or the ability to create home pages) from the Co-Branded Pages without needing theglobe's consent, and if Boxlot desires to do so, the parties will work together to discuss appropriate implementations.  Boxlot shall make available via the Shadow Site all changes to the Service or the Co-Branded Pages completed in this Section 2, and Boxlot shall implement such changes on the publicly available Service or Co-Branded Pages without needing theglobe's approval.
perturbation.explanation: The original text stated that `theglobe` has sole control over the service's look and feel, and `Boxlot` needs approval for changes. It also prohibits community features without consent. The modified version gives `Boxlot` complete autonomy over the look and feel, allowing them to implement changes and community features without `theglobe's` consent, directly contradicting the original provision. The uncertainty lies in who ultimately controls the co-branded pages.

perturbation.original_text: 8.1  Term.  This Agreement will become effective on the Effective Date and will continue in effect for 2 years following the Launch Date.
perturbation.changed_text: 8.1  Term.  This Agreement will become effective on the Effective Date and will continue in effect until either party decides to terminate the agreement.
perturbation.explanation: The original text set a fixed term of 2 years. The modified version introduces ambiguity by stating the agreement continues until either party decides to terminate, effectively turning it into an indefinite term, which contradicts the initial 2-year agreement. It makes the enforcement uncertain.

perturbation.original_text: 11.  LIABILITY LIMITS.  NEITHER PARTY SHALL BE LIABLE FOR LOST PROFITS OR SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (HOWEVER ARISING, INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE) ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THIS AGREEMENT, EVEN IF THE PARTIES ARE AWARE OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. EXCEPT IN THE EVENT OF A CLAIM UNDER SECTION 10 OR FAILURE TO PAY UNDER SECTION 6, IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE TO THE OTHER PARTY IN AN AMOUNT GREATER THAN THE AMOUNT BOXLOT ACTUALLY PAYS TO THEGLOBE HEREUNDER.
perturbation.changed_text: 11.  LIABILITY LIMITS.  NEITHER PARTY SHALL BE LIABLE FOR LOST PROFITS OR SPECIAL, INCIDENTAL OR CONSEQUENTIAL DAMAGES (HOWEVER ARISING, INCLUDING NEGLIGENCE) ARISING OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THIS AGREEMENT, EVEN IF THE PARTIES ARE AWARE OF THE POSSIBILITY OF SUCH DAMAGES. IN NO EVENT SHALL EITHER PARTY BE LIABLE TO THE OTHER PARTY FOR ANY AMOUNT WHATSOEVER, REGARDLESS OF SECTION 10 OR FAILURE TO PAY UNDER SECTION 6.
perturbation.explanation: The original text included exceptions to the liability limit for claims under Section 10 (Indemnity) or failure to pay under Section 6 (Payment Terms). The modified version removes these exceptions, stating that neither party shall be liable for any amount, regardless of those sections. This creates a contradiction because Section 10 outlines indemnification obligations, and Section 6 outlines payment obligations, both of which are now unenforceable due to the added text. The enforceability of indemnity and payment clauses are put into doubt.
